page.title: 18Black Cherry Fair
page.content: Today, there is a market held on Saturdays in Windsor Street. It has about six stalls. It used to be more important as rights to hold markets have been held from the time of the Abbey. These suffered various interuptions e.g. Wars of the Roses and moved in the days of the week. Chertsey had various fairs which included the "Onion Fair", held on Holy Cross Day and the "Black Cherry Fair" held on St. Ann's Hill on the 26th July. A wide variety of goods were traded. The "Black Cherry Fair" has been revived in the past 5 years. It takes place at Abbey Fields in July. It is opened by a procession of floats through Chertsey. During the fair there is a fancy dress competition and a dog show.
